plentry.pd: The exposure factor of the camera. The default value is 0, which means using the camera's default exposure. The larger the value, the greater the exposure. If the video image is overexposed, you can lower the exposure factor; if the video image is underexposed and dark details are lost, you can increase the exposure factor. If the specified exposure factor exceeds the supported range of the device, the SDK automatically adjusts it to the supported range. On Android, the range is [-20.0,20.0]; on iOS, the range is [-8.0,8.0].

Exposure factor of the camera. The default value is 0, which means using the camera's default exposure. The larger the value, the greater the exposure. If the specified value exceeds the device's supported range, the SDK automatically adjusts it to a supported value. On Android, the range is [-20.0, 20.0]; on iOS, the range is [-8.0, 8.0].
